intro: Melissitus gracilis, commonly known as the slender melissitus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it a notable species in ecological studies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native habitat.
